Configuration.ChangeDescription: Various enhancements and fixes. Added support for new versions of Exchange-aware antivirus products. New configuration version is 2.10.0.1

Object.Name: EXRAP Customer Branding
Full Run
SQL Server Risk Assessment
Operational Interview
Operational Excellence
People
Do you know who your Customer Support Manager (CSM) is? (The Customer Support Manager (CSM) is the primary role for service delivery on your Microsoft Premier Support Agreement)

Rule.Name: fCSMNotKnown
Rule.Text: Do you know who your Customer Support Manager (CSM) is? (The Customer Support Manager (CSM) is the primary role for service delivery on your Microsoft Premier Support Agreement)

Object.Name: Does your operations staff know how to create an incident/support request with CSS?

Rule.Name: fNotKnowIncidentCreation
Rule.Text: Does your operations staff know how to create an incident/support request with CSS?

Object.Name: Are SQL Server staff roles clearly defined and filled?

Rule.Name: fNoDedicatedDBAStaff
Rule.Text: Are SQL Server staff roles clearly defined and filled?

Object.Name: Do you require base-level certification for your operations staff?

Rule.Name: fNoStaffBaselineCert
Rule.Text: Do you require base-level certification for your operations staff?

Object.Name: General
Do you have a performance baseline of all the SQL Server servers to use as a comparison for performance tuning?
Do you have a processor time baseline?

Rule.Name: fNoProcessorBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a processor time baseline?

Object.Name: Do you have a disk I/O baseline for log and database drives?

Rule.Name: fNodiskIOBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a disk I/O baseline for log and database drives?

Object.Name: Do you have a disk latency baseline?

Rule.Name: fNoDiskLatencyBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a disk latency baseline?

Object.Name: Do you have a user load baseline?

Rule.Name: fNoUserLoadBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a user load baseline?

Object.Name: Do you have a memory baseline?

Rule.Name: fNoMemoryBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a memory baseline?

Object.Name: Do you have a performance baseline for pertinent counters?

Rule.Name: fNoSQLServerCounterBaseline
Rule.Text: Do you have a performance baseline for pertinent counters?

Rule.Name: fNoPerfBaselines
Rule.Text: Do you have a performance baseline of all the SQL Server servers to use as a comparison for performance tuning?

Object.Name: Do you update index statistics on a regular basis?

Rule.Name: fNoUpdateStatistics
Rule.Text: Do you update index statistics on a regular basis?

Object.Name: Do you perform index defragementation on a scheduled basis?

Rule.Name: fNoIndexDefragSchedule
Rule.Text: Do you perform index defragementation on a scheduled basis?

Object.Name: Do you perform regular DBCC checks in your production environment?

Rule.Name: fNoRegularDBCCCheck
Rule.Text: Do you perform regular DBCC checks in your production environment?

Object.Name: Business Continuity
Do you have a documented disaster recovery plan?
Is your disaster recovery plan documented thoroughly enough so that any member of your staff can perform a successful recovery when needed?

Rule.Name: fCannotFollowDRPLan
Rule.Text: Is your disaster recovery plan documented thoroughly enough so that any member of your staff can perform a successful recovery when needed?

Rule.Name: fNoDRPlan
Rule.Text: Do you have a documented disaster recovery plan?

Object.Name: Have you defined disaster recovery service level agreements (SLAs) for backup and recovery?

Rule.Name: fNoDRSLA
Rule.Text: Have you defined disaster recovery service level agreements (SLAs) for backup and recovery?

Object.Name: Do you practice or test your disaster recovery plans at least once every six months?

Rule.Name: fNoDRPlanTest
Rule.Text: Do you practice or test your disaster recovery plans at least once every six months?

Object.Name: Do you have dedicated servers for SQL Server disaster recovery?

Rule.Name: fNoDedicatedDRServers
Rule.Text: Do you have dedicated servers for SQL Server disaster recovery?

Object.Name: Do database administrators have physical access to database servers when necessary, or have correct contact and access to those who do?

Rule.Name: fNoPhysicalDBServerAccess
Rule.Text: Do database administrators have physical access to database servers when necessary, or have correct contact and access to those who do?

Object.Name: Do database administrators have physical access to SQL Server install media or have correct contact and access to those who do?

Rule.Name: fNoInstallMediaAccess
Rule.Text: Do database administrators have physical access to SQL Server install media or have correct contact and access to those who do?

Object.Name: Do you back up both system and user databases?

Rule.Name: fInadquateBackupStrategy
Rule.Text: Do you back up both system and user databases?

Object.Name: What is your backup media?

Rule.Name: fMediaBackupStrategyNotBP
Rule.Text: What is your backup media?

Object.Name: How do you secure your backup files?

Rule.Name: fUnsecureBackups
Rule.Text: How do you secure your backup files?

Object.Name: Is there a process in place to verify that your backups are valid and restorable?

Rule.Name: fBackupsNotValidated
Rule.Text: Is there a process in place to verify that your backups are valid and restorable?

Object.Name: Is there a process in place to protect and verify the SQL Server configuration data and dependencies? (registry, replication schema, system databases…)

Rule.Name: fSQLServerConfigNotBackup
Rule.Text: Is there a process in place to protect and verify the SQL Server configuration data and dependencies? (registry, replication schema, system databases…)

Object.Name: Do you back up more than transaction logs during business hours?

Rule.Name: fBackupsNotOptimizedforMinBizImpact
Rule.Text: Do you back up more than transaction logs during business hours?

Object.Name: Do you utilize a Stripe Set for SQL Server backups?

Rule.Name: fBackupMultipleDevices
Rule.Text: Do you utilize a Stripe Set for SQL Server backups?

Object.Name: Do you have additional disk space available on the SQL Server servers for the database restore use?

Rule.Name: fNoSpaceForDBRestore
Rule.Text: Do you have additional disk space available on the SQL Server servers for the database restore use?

Object.Name: Do you have an additional backup copy offsite?
Can you restore from offsite backup to meet your data recovery requirements (SLA/OLA)?

Rule.Name: fBackupsTakeTooLong
Rule.Text: Can you restore from offsite backup to meet your data recovery requirements (SLA/OLA)?

Rule.Name: fNoOffsiteBackupsUsed
Rule.Text: Do you have an additional backup copy offsite?

Object.Name: What kind of RAID is used for SQL Server data volumes?

Rule.Name: fInappropriateRaidLevel
Rule.Text: What kind of RAID is used for SQL Server data volumes?

Object.Name: Is data storage shared or dedicated to SQL Server?

Rule.Name: fSharedDataStorage
Rule.Text: Is data storage shared or dedicated to SQL Server?

Object.Name: Do you implement “stretch clusters” (geo-clustering) or other data replication technologies for SQL Server?

Rule.Name: fNonSQLReplicationUsed
Rule.Text: Do you implement “stretch clusters” (geo-clustering) or other data replication technologies for SQL Server?

Object.Name: What high availability options are configured?
Is your SQL Server failover cluster solution listed in the Windows Server Catalog (WSC)/Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)?

Rule.Name: fClusterOnHCL
Rule.Text: Is your SQL Server failover cluster solution listed in the Windows Server Catalog (WSC)/Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)?

Rule.Name: fHighAvailOptionsIncreaseComplexity
Rule.Text: What high availability options are configured?

Rule.Name: fNoHighAvailOptionsConfigured
Rule.Text: What high availability options are configured?

Object.Name: Change, Configuration and Release Management (CCR)
Do you have a change control process?

Rule.Name: fNoChangeControl
Rule.Text: Do you have a change control process?

Object.Name: Do you have a separate, dedicated environment for non-production activity (for example, development or testing)?

Rule.Name: fNoDedicatedNonProdEnvironment
Rule.Text: Do you have a separate, dedicated environment for non-production activity (for example, development or testing)?

Object.Name: Do your release and deployment plans include a rollback plan?

Rule.Name: fNoRollbackPlan
Rule.Text: Do your release and deployment plans include a rollback plan?

Object.Name: Does the Database Operations team have an approval voice for other IT changes that might affect the database service?

Rule.Name: fDBOpsApprovalVoice
Rule.Text: Does the Database Operations team have an approval voice for other IT changes that might affect the database service?

Object.Name: Do you have scheduled releases to keep the hardware, operating system, SQL Server, and antivirus software on the servers up to date (for example, service packs)?

Rule.Name: fNoScheduleForSPsReleases
Rule.Text: Do you have scheduled releases to keep the hardware, operating system, SQL Server, and antivirus software on the servers up to date (for example, service packs)?

Object.Name: Do you apply Microsoft Windows updates (non security patches) to your servers at least every six months?

Rule.Name: fInfrequentWindowsUpdates
Rule.Text: Do you apply Microsoft Windows updates (non security patches) to your servers at least every six months?

Object.Name: Do you apply Microsoft SQL Server updates (non security patches) to your servers at least every six months?

Rule.Name: fInfrequentSQLUpdates
Rule.Text: Do you apply Microsoft SQL Server updates (non security patches) to your servers at least every six months?

Object.Name: Do you review and proactively apply security updates (patches) as they become available?
Does it take more than a week to apply a critical security update to all servers?

Rule.Name: fTooLongSecurityUpdates
Rule.Text: Does it take more than a week to apply a critical security update to all servers?

Rule.Name: fInfrequentSecurityUpdates
Rule.Text: Do you review and proactively apply security updates (patches) as they become available?

Object.Name: Do you review and test updates before deployment?

Rule.Name: fNoReviewTestUpdates
Rule.Text: Do you review and test updates before deployment?

Object.Name: Do you have a lab that contains the same roles, code, and services you run in the production environment where you can test changes in the code and configuration?

Rule.Name: fNoProdLikeEnvironment
Rule.Text: Do you have a lab that contains the same roles, code, and services you run in the production environment where you can test changes in the code and configuration?

Object.Name: Do you have detailed Microsoft Windows and SQL Server build documents for your servers?

Rule.Name: fNoBuildDocs
Rule.Text: Do you have detailed Microsoft Windows and SQL Server build documents for your servers?

Object.Name: Do you allow ad-hoc change to occur in your production environment

Rule.Name: fAdHocChangesAllowed
Rule.Text: Do you allow ad-hoc change to occur in your production environment

Object.Name: Service Monitoring and Control
Do you monitor your Microsoft SQL Server environment?
Which of the following do you monitor?

Rule.Name: fMonitoringNotComprehensive
Rule.Text: Which of the following do you monitor?

Object.Name: Is there an action plan or operations guide for each alert, such as a troubleshooting guide?

Rule.Name: fNoOpsGuideForAlerts
Rule.Text: Is there an action plan or operations guide for each alert, such as a troubleshooting guide?

Object.Name: Is there someone who is held accountable for responding to each alert?

Rule.Name: fNoresponsibleForAlerts
Rule.Text: Is there someone who is held accountable for responding to each alert?

Object.Name: Do you have automated notifications for monitored alerts?

Rule.Name: fNoAutomatedAlerts
Rule.Text: Do you have automated notifications for monitored alerts?

Object.Name: Is your Microsoft SQL Server environment monitored 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?

Rule.Name: fMonitoringNot247
Rule.Text: Is your Microsoft SQL Server environment monitored 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?

Rule.Name: fNoSQLMonitoring
Rule.Text: Do you monitor your Microsoft SQL Server environment?

Object.Name: Service Level Management
Do you have defined operating level agreements (OLAs) for the database service?
Does your operating level agreement (OLA) include a database restore time?

Rule.Name: fOLArestoreTime
Rule.Text: Does your operating level agreement (OLA) include a database restore time?

Object.Name: Do you have defined operating level agreements (OLAs) with the teams who own the services that support the database service?

Rule.Name: fNoOLAswithSupportingTeams
Rule.Text: Do you have defined operating level agreements (OLAs) with the teams who own the services that support the database service?

Object.Name: Do you meet regularly as a team to review performance against OLAs and to define target action?

Rule.Name: fNoOLAReviews
Rule.Text: Do you meet regularly as a team to review performance against OLAs and to define target action?

Rule.Name: fNoOLAs
Rule.Text: Do you have defined operating level agreements (OLAs) for the database service?

Object.Name: Do you have regularly scheduled times to perform maintenance?

Rule.Name: fNoRegularMaintenanceTime
Rule.Text: Do you have regularly scheduled times to perform maintenance?

Object.Name: Do you regularly review with the business units the service level targets and your team's performance against those targets?

Rule.Name: fNoSLAReviews
Rule.Text: Do you regularly review with the business units the service level targets and your team's performance against those targets?

Object.Name: Are you able to meet your service level agreements?

Rule.Name: fDoesNotMeetSLAs
Rule.Text: Are you able to meet your service level agreements?

Object.Name: Do you measure application availability in your environment?
Is the application availability measurement automated?

Rule.Name: fAvailMeasureNotAutomated
Rule.Text: Is the application availability measurement automated?

Rule.Name: fNoMeasureAvailability
Rule.Text: Do you measure application availability in your environment?

Object.Name: Do you measure user, customer, and business unit satisfaction with the database service?

Rule.Name: fNoMeasureSatisfaction
Rule.Text: Do you measure user, customer, and business unit satisfaction with the database service?

Object.Name: Security
How do you classify your data for security?
What technologies does your organization use to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data at the store and in transit?

Rule.Name: fHBIDataNotSecured
Rule.Text: What technologies does your organization use to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data at the store and in transit?

Rule.Name: fSecureDataIncreaseComplexity
Rule.Text: What technologies does your organization use to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data at the store and in transit?

Rule.Name: fDataNotClassifiedForSecurity
Rule.Text: How do you classify your data for security?

Rule.Name: fDummy
Rule.Text: How do you classify your data for security?

Object.Name: Do you enable only the network libraries that you absolutely require? (This is dependent on what the customer requires - named pipes, tcp/ip, etc.)

Rule.Name: fUnnecessaryLibraries
Rule.Text: Do you enable only the network libraries that you absolutely require? (This is dependent on what the customer requires - named pipes, tcp/ip, etc.)

Object.Name: Do new designs or core changes to the SQL Server infrastructure go through a formal security review process (internal or external)?

Rule.Name: fNoSecurityReview
Rule.Text: Do new designs or core changes to the SQL Server infrastructure go through a formal security review process (internal or external)?

Object.Name: Do you perform security logging in the SQL Server environment?

Rule.Name: fNoSecuriyLogging
Rule.Text: Do you perform security logging in the SQL Server environment?

Object.Name: What technologies does your organization use to restrict or regulate access to user data?

Rule.Name: fInsufficientDataAccessRestrictions
Rule.Text: What technologies does your organization use to restrict or regulate access to user data?

Object.Name: How often does an audit occur to verify that only appropriate users have access to databases?

Rule.Name: fInsufficientAccessAuditing
Rule.Text: How often does an audit occur to verify that only appropriate users have access to databases?

Object.Name: Environmental Dependencies (Environment)
OS Configuration
Do you have antivirus software installed on your SQL Server?
Do your antivirus file exclusions follow best practices?

Rule.Name: fAntivirusMisconfigured
Rule.Text: Do your antivirus file exclusions follow best practices?

Rule.Name: fNoAntivirusOnSQL
Rule.Text: Do you have antivirus software installed on your SQL Server?

Object.Name: Are servers physically secure?

Rule.Name: fServersNotPhysicallySecure
Rule.Text: Are servers physically secure?

Object.Name: Is hyper-threading enabled on Windows 2000 server in the assessed environment?

Rule.Name: fHyperThreadingOnWinTwoK
Rule.Text: Is hyper-threading enabled on Windows 2000 server in the assessed environment?

Object.Name: Protocols
Do your servers in the network perimeter have all unnecessary protocols and ports disabled including SMB?

Rule.Name: fSMBNotDisabled
Rule.Text: Do your servers in the network perimeter have all unnecessary protocols and ports disabled including SMB?

Object.Name: SQL Architecture
TSQL Coding

For PFE Only: Check the boxes below if you would like to EXCLUDE these sections from the Key Findings report. Exclude these only if you plan to not run any tests corresponding to these sections and , therefore, do not want them in the report. If you later choose to run tests and issues are found, the sections will appear.

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLCursors
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Cursors data via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLExecution
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Execution via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLHints
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Hints via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLLogicalExpressions
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Logical Expressions via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLNamingConventions
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Naming Conventions via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLNotLogic
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Logic via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressTSQLXML
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process XML data via T_SQL?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_supressDatabaseDesign
Rule.Text: Do you process or plan to process Database Design data via T_SQL?

Object.Name: SQL Configuration
Configuration Settings
Is the customer using Startup Parameters?

Rule.Name: fStartupParametersUsed
Rule.Text: Is the customer using Startup Parameters?

Object.Name: High Availability
Clustering
Does the environment you are on site to assess utilize SQL Server Clustering?
Is there more than one Cluster IP Address used for the SQL Server Resource?

Rule.Name: fMultipleIPAddressForSQLResource
Rule.Text: Is there more than one Cluster IP Address used for the SQL Server Resource?

Object.Name: Do your side-by-side SQL Server 2000/2005 clustered instances use the same service account?

Rule.Name: fTwokTwokFiveUsingSameSvcAccount
Rule.Text: Do your side-by-side SQL Server 2000/2005 clustered instances use the same service account?

Object.Name: Are there non-SQL Server resources that are dependent on the SQL Server resource?

Rule.Name: fNonSQLServerResourceDependent
Rule.Text: Are there non-SQL Server resources that are dependent on the SQL Server resource?

Rule.Name: CategoryNotAvailable_fhasNoHighAvailabilityClusteringDeployed
Rule.Text: Does the environment you are on site to assess utilize SQL Server Clustering?
